contentrichtext.text: {{Wiktionary|mob}} '''Mob''' commonly refers to a [[crowd]] of people (from Latin ''mobile vulgus'', meaning "fickle commoners"). '''Mob''' or '''mobbing''' may also refer to: ==In bullying and intimidation== *[[Mobbing]], human bullying behaviour *[[Mobbing (animal behavior)]] ==In computing== * [[Mob (video gaming)]], a monster or non-player character in a computer game, short for "mobile" * [[Smart mob]], a temporary self-structuring social organization, coordinated through telecommunication ==In criminals== *[[American Mafia]] *A criminal [[gang]] *[[Mafia]] *[[Organized crime]] *A group of [[vigilante]]s ==In law, law enforcement, and politics== *[[Mobbing (Scots law)]] *An angry mob; see [[ochlocracy]] *The [[Mobile Party]], the people in the streets, appealed to by an English politician lacking support in Parliament (17th & 18th centuries). "A politician who lacked backing in Parliament referred to his “mobile party”— the people in the streets. (This was the origin of “mob.”)" [http://www.mysanantonio.com/news/article/Mobile-party-long-part-of-urban-civilization-2143143.php T.R. Fehrenbach] ==In other uses== * [[Flash mob]], social phenomenon * ''Australian'' A flock or herd of animals (example: a mob of [[Kangaroo|kangaroos]]) ==In acronyms== MOB may mean: * [[Magyar Olimpiai Bizottság]], National Olympic Committee of Hungary * [[Mail-order bride]], a woman who publishes her intent to marry someone from another country * [[Main Operating Base]], an overseas, permanently manned, well protected base, used to support permanently deployed forces, and with robust sea and/or air access * [[Man overboard]], a person has fallen off a boat or ship into the water and is in need of rescue * [[Marching Owl Band]], the Rice University "marching band" * [[Mars or Bust]], a slogan used within the American Scientific Community to promote a manned space mission to the planet Mars * [[Mission of Burma]], an American post-punk band formed in Boston, Massachusetts in 1979 * [[Mobile offshore base]], a concept for supporting military operations where conventional land bases are not available * [[Mobile Regional Airport]] (IATA airport code), located in Mobile, Alabama * [[Montreux-Oberland Bernois]], Swiss railway * [[Movable object block]], used in computer graphics * Member of [[Bloods]], a member of the Bloods street gang * ''Motos Operacionais de Bombeiros'', motorcycles used as ambulances in Brazil: see [[Motorcycle ambulance#Brazil]] ==See also== * [[The Mob (disambiguation)]] {{disambig}}
